content.description: SDS on two low crimps, follow the slopey rails straight up to the topout. Big movement to slopey holds, be ready for a throw to a crimpy rail at the top. Large volume to the right that looks like it would be a perfect platform for feet is off, use bottom crimpy rails for really good feet.
content.location: Two starting crimps are to the right of Butt Sparkles V4 on the overhanging wall with the big slopey rails.

content.description: Start on two small crimps on a vertical rail, throw to the big jug to the right and move up the center of the boulder. Bottom is the crux with absolutely classic, heavily core-involved movement!
content.location: Located on the center of the big overhang on the north side of the boulder. Find the huge, obviously chalked up jug at the bottom-center of the face, the start will be about 3 feet to the left of that on the rail.

content.description: This beautiful block sits in far view from the road to the left of the gate. Has a huge overhand on the east face with huge crimps and multiple rails for big moves. Developed routes so far sit on the north side of the boulder, and this is where you'll find the most potential for problems. There's a small cave on the west face right beside the downclimb, but it looks to be too cramped for any good problems.
